com.jcraft.jsch

Interface GSSContext


  • public interface GSSContext
    Usually not to be used by applications.

    Encapsulates a GSS context, i.e. an implementation of the GSS API. This is used by UserAuthGSSAPIWithMIC to do the actual cryptographic work. (See this class for a description on how this interface is used.)

    This interface only contains the methods needed for GSS-API authentication, not the full GSS API.

    An implementation of this interface is included in the JSch library, based on the GSS API included in the Java SE from 1.4 on, using object ID 1.2.840.113554.1.2.2, i.e. Kerberos v5 as defined in RFC 1964.

    See Also:
    GSSContext, RFC 2743, Generic Security Service Application Program Interface Version 2, Update 1, RFC 5653: Generic Security Service API Version 2: Java Bindings Update, RFC 4462: Generic Security Service Application Program Interface (GSS-API) Authentication and Key Exchange for the Secure Shell (SSH) Protocol, RFC 1964, The Kerberos Version 5 GSS-API Mechanism

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void create(String user, String host)
      creates the context.
      void dispose()
      Disposes this context, releasing any system resources and stored cryptographic information.
      byte[] getMIC(byte[] message, int s, int l)
      calculates a Message Integrity Code for a message.
      byte[] init(byte[] token, int s, int l)
      Tries to establish the secure context by processing a token from the server and (maybe) creating a new token to send to the server.
      boolean isEstablished()
      Checks is the context establishing already succeeded.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        void create(String user,
            String host)
     throws JSchException
        creates the context.
        Parameters:
        user - the user name.
        host - the server's name.
        Throws:
        JSchException
        See Also:
        GSSManager

      • isEstablished

        boolean isEstablished()
        Checks is the context establishing already succeeded.

      • init

        byte[] init(byte[] token,
            int s,
            int l)
     throws JSchException
        Tries to establish the secure context by processing a token from the server and (maybe) creating a new token to send to the server.
        Parameters:
        token - an array containing the token received from the server. At the start, this will be an empty array.
        s - the index in token where the token actually starts.
        l - the length of the token.
        Returns:
        the token to be sent to the server (if length > 0).
        Throws:
        JSchException
        See Also:
        GSSContext

      • getMIC

        byte[] getMIC(byte[] message,
              int s,
              int l)
        calculates a Message Integrity Code for a message.
        Parameters:
        message - an array containing the message for which the the code should be calculated.
        s - the index in message where the message actually starts
        l - the length of the message.
        Returns:
        a token containing the MIC for the message.
        See Also:
        GSSContext

      • dispose

        void dispose()
        Disposes this context, releasing any system resources and stored cryptographic information. The context can't be used after this call.
